video_caption: The video begins with a solid blue background, transitioning to a screen displaying the text "sibos LONDON 23 - 26 Sep 2019" in white font. The scene then shifts to a man in a dark suit and patterned tie, standing against a plain white background. The "sibos" logo is visible in the top left corner. Subtitles appear at the bottom of the screen, reading, "It's great to be part of this year's Sibos conference." The man, identified as Mark Carney, Governor of the Bank of England, continues speaking, with subtitles stating, "which is being hosted in London for the very first time." He elaborates on London's status as a leading FinTech hub, with subtitles reading, "and it's now also one of the world's leading FinTech hubs." The man then addresses the audience, saying, "And I know you're gonna spend most of your time, right," followed by, "but I want to take this short opportunity." The video concludes with the man stating, "to support your efforts to create the future of finance," emphasizing the importance of the conference in shaping the future of finance.

The video opens with a blue background featuring the text "THE FUTURE OF FINANCE" and a subtitle "As this conference recognises," followed by a man in a suit and tie speaking against a white background. The text "INCREASED - digitisation - connectivity" appears, emphasizing the growing importance of these factors in finance. The narrative continues with the text "New economy requires a new finance" and "A new finance to serve the digital economy," highlighting the need for innovation and resilience in the financial sector. The scene transitions to a blue background with the "BANK OF ENGLAND" logo and the text "Enable innovation Empower competition," stressing the bank's role in fostering innovation and competition. The video concludes with the text "all while insuring the resilience of the financial system," underscoring the importance of maintaining financial stability amidst these changes. Throughout the video, the "sibos" logo is visible in the top left corner, indicating the conference's branding.

The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking directly to the camera against a plain white background. The logo "sibos" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The man discusses the evolving nature of commerce and the digital economy, emphasizing the shift towards real-time transactions and the indistinguishability of payments across borders. Subtitles at the bottom of the screen provide a translation of his speech, highlighting the increasing importance of digital payments and the need for private innovation to meet these demands. The man maintains a professional demeanor, with his facial expressions and gestures underscoring the significance of his message. The video features a man in a dark suit and patterned tie speaking against a plain white background, with the logo "sibos" visible in the top left corner. He discusses the recent changes in the payment system RTGS, highlighting that commercial banks previously had direct access to it, but now, with the emergence of distributed finance, a broader set of firms can plug into the system. The scene transitions to a blue background with text stating "5 payment service providers already members of RTGS" and "20 new firms ready to join RTGS," indicating the expansion of RTGS membership. The video then shows a slide titled "RTGS rebuild: to provide API access to users to read and write payments data," emphasizing the system's modernization. The man continues to speak, mentioning the global impact of these changes, which speed up settlement processes worldwide. The video maintains a professional and informative tone throughout, focusing on the evolution and accessibility of the RTGS system.

The next frame displays the text "Banking 2nd biggest global spender on AI systems," with a subtitle stating, "biggest global spender on AI systems." The video concludes with the man speaking again, with the text "and if properly managed, they can improve the" displayed on the screen. Throughout the video, the man maintains a professional demeanor, and the background remains consistent with the "sibos" logo visible in the top left corner.
